COVID-19 Update 3/13/20 - PM Update

br.em: School Closing issued by Gov. Kay Ivey

div.span: Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey has issued a State of Emergency for Alabama. As of the close of business on March 18th, all schools K-12 in the state of Alabama will be CLOSED for two and a half weeks to practice social distancing and hopefully lessen the spread of COVID-19. Alexander City Schools will be out for Spring Break beginning Monday, March 16th. Due to the mandated school closure, students and faculty will not return until April 6, 2020. The closures affects all programming at the school, including before- and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and weekend events.

Please continue to check Alexander City Schools website www.alexcityschools.net for the latest information. Updates will be provided to students, parents, and guardians throughout the extended closure to ensure effective communication about plans moving forward.

p.span: Dear Parents and Guardians,

Over the past few days, discussion and media coverage in regards to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) has increased at the local, state, and national levels. Please be assured that we are diligently monitoring this situation based on guidance from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Alabama Department of Public Health (ADPH), and Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE).

Based on the most recent information available, Coronavirus symptoms are similar to the flu. With this in mind, we will continue the following protocol at each campus and request that all students, parents and employees become even more diligent in taking a proactive approach to limit and perhaps prevent this virus from spreading should it reach our community.
Preventive action protocol:
Continuous cleaning and disinfecting of commonly shared surfaces.
Encourage good hygiene practices such as proper handwashing and covering coughs.
Promote the “24-hour fever-free without the use of fever-reducing medications” practice as advised by both the CDC and ADPH.
Encourage staff and students to avoid close contact with people who are sick.
As advised by the Alabama Department of Education, Alexander City Schools will be canceling all field trips effective immediately through April 30, 2020.

As in all situations, we will maintain a proactive and responsive approach to issues and concerns that may impact the well-being of our students and staff. Should we receive additional information and guidance by the above agencies, we will modify our practices as may be necessary.
Please visit our website for the latest information regarding COVID-19.
We appreciate your support as we strive to provide a healthy environment for our students and staff.
Sincerely,
Dr. Keith Lankford, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Alexander City Schools

Alexander City Schools is aware of the many concerns and media attention about the ongoing spread of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and its potential impact on our schools. Please be assured that we will continue to stay abreast of the information coming from the Alabama Department of Education and the Alabama Department of Public Health(ADPH).

According to the ADPH website, Alabama is still considered to be low risk at this time and no cases of the coronavirus have been confirmed as of March 9, 2020. We will be sharing updates and information if it becomes necessary.

While the risk in our area remains low, we all have a role to play in decreasing the spread of this disease and others in our community. Practicing the following recommendations can protect yourself, your children, and families:

Updated Messaging - 3.12.20

In our continuing effort to provide ongoing and timely information regarding the coronavirus and how it might impact our schools we wanted to share a brief update. Students and faculty will be on spring break next week and will return on Monday, March 23, 2020. Spring break has NOT been extended. Dr. Keith Lankford, Superintendent, and the Alexander City School Board are currently developing plans for various scenarios concerning the coronavirus (COVID-19). We will keep everyone updated as it relates to our school system. At this time we do not support, condone, or encourage our students, faculty and staff to travel out of the country or stateside in affected areas. If you choose to travel during spring break, please know there could be precautionary measures prior to reentering the school system. The safety and wellbeing of our students, faculty and staff is always our first priority.
